subject.name: Mathematics-III (Differential Calculus)
subject.description: Focuses on advanced topics in differential calculus, vector calculus, and differential equations. Introduces higher-order differentiation, partial derivatives, and applications to physical and engineering problems using vector and differential equation techniques.
objectives: To understand the concepts of higher-order differentiation and Leibnitz’s theorem
To study limits, continuity, and differentiability for single and multivariable functions
To apply vector calculus to physical and engineering problems
To solve ordinary and partial differential equations of various types
To use differential calculus methods for optimization and modeling

units.title: Successive Differentiation and Basic Concepts
topics: Successive Differentiation
Leibnitz’s Theorem
Limit, Continuity, and Differentiability of a function for one variable

units.title: Functions of Several Variables and Partial Differentiation
topics: Limit, Continuity, and Differentiability of functions of several variables
Partial Derivatives and Euler’s Theorem for Homogeneous Functions
Total Derivatives and Change of Variables
Maxima and Minima of several variables
Lagrange’s Method of Multipliers
Taylor’s and Maclaurin’s Theorem with remainders for several variables

units.title: Vector Calculus
topics: Gradient, Divergence, and Curl of a Vector and their Physical Interpretations
Vector Identities and Directional Derivatives
Line, Surface, and Volume Integrals
Applications of Green’s, Stokes’, and Gauss Divergence Theorems (Without Proof)

units.title: First Order Ordinary Differential Equations
topics: Exact, Linear, and Bernoulli’s Equations
Euler’s Equations
Equations not of First Degree
Equations Solvable for P, Y, X, and Clairaut’s Type

units.title: Higher Order Ordinary Differential Equations
topics: Second Order Linear Differential Equations with Variable Coefficients
Method of Variation of Parameters
Cauchy–Euler Equation
Power Series Solutions
Legendre Polynomials and Bessel Functions of the First Kind with their Properties

units.title: Partial Differential Equations
topics: First Order Partial Differential Equations
Solutions of First Order Linear and Non-Linear PDEs
